questions.question: What is the CCE IIT Mandi Minor Program?
questions.answer: The IIT Mandi Minor Program is a three-semester, credit-linked certification offered by IIT Mandi in collaboration with NSDC, Masai, and select partner universities. It is designed to help students build practical, industry-relevant skills alongside their main degree.

questions.question: Who can apply?
questions.answer: Students from any stream enrolled at a participating partner university are eligible to apply.

questions.question: What specialisations are available?
questions.answer: Students can choose from four Minor tracks: Artificial Intelligence, Computer Science & Advanced Technologies, Data Science & Machine Learning, and Business Analytics.

questions.question: What is the program structure and duration?
questions.answer: The Minor runs for 3 semesters, covering 18 academic credits (7 + 8 + 3). The curriculum blends live weekend classes, hands-on projects, real-world case studies, and mentorship.

questions.question: What are the key learning features?
questions.answer: Classes are delivered by IIT Mandi faculty and industry experts. Students benefit from an AI-powered learning platform (LMS), live sessions, offline exams, masterclasses, and offline mentorship opportunities. Placement and internship support are available for students maintaining a CGPA of 7.0 or above.

questions.question: Will I receive a certificate?
questions.answer: Yes. On successful completion, students receive an official Minor Certificate from IIT Mandi.

questions.question: What is the program fee?
questions.answer: The total fee is ₹45,000, payable in three instalments of ₹15,000 per semester.

questions.question: Are there offline components?
questions.answer: Where applicable, students may have opportunities for in-person mentorship or to attend an on-campus graduation ceremony.

questions.question: Who conducts assessments?
questions.answer: Evaluations are conducted jointly by IIT Mandi, Masai, and the partner universities through a combination of online and offline assessments.

questions.question: Is this a degree program?
questions.answer: No. This is a part-time, credit-linked certification program, not equivalent to a full B.Tech degree. Credits earned can be added to a student’s Academic Bank of Credits (ABC) as per NEP guidelines.

questions.question: What is the medium of instruction?
questions.answer: All sessions and materials are provided in English.

questions.question: Whom can I contact for support?
questions.answer: For any questions, please reach out to info.cce@iitmandi.ac.in or call us at 6364919735.

questions.question: I am from a non-technical background. Will I be able to cope with the program?
questions.answer: Yes, absolutely. This course is designed so that even a non-tech person can learn everything.

questions.question: I have basic knowledge of AI/Python/BA/Data Science fundamentals. Can I start directly from the second Module?
questions.answer: The program does not offer lateral entry into the second Module, as the first Module serves as a prerequisite. We recommend starting from the first Module to ensure you have the foundational knowledge needed for success. By fully engaging with the assignments, evaluations, and projects, you’ll not only refine your skills but also set yourself up to excel and achieve a CGPA of 7 or higher.

questions.question: Do I need to have in-depth knowledge of Mathematics for this program?
questions.answer: No prior in-depth knowledge is needed to join this course. As the concepts that will be taught will be from fundamental topics.

questions.question: I have “0” knowledge about coding. Can I enrol in the program?
questions.answer: Yes, no prior knowledge is required. The program starts from the basics.

questions.question: Who will be taking the classes?
questions.answer: Theory classes are conducted by the IIT Professors, & Tutorials are taken by Ph.D Research Scholars from IIT. During the live classes, new concepts will be taught to you, and tutorial sessions are doubt-clearing sessions.

questions.question: What will be the class timings?
questions.answer: Weekday classes are between 7 PM to 10 PM, and weekend classes are between 09 AM to 5 PM.

questions.question: Is attendance mandatory for all classes?
questions.answer: Attendance in live classes is highly recommended as you will be able to grasp concepts better with the flow of live classes. The classes will be scheduled at a time which is after your college/ in most cases office hours. However, if you miss any live sessions, recordings will be made available to you on the learning platform.

questions.question: Do we have offline classes?
questions.answer: No, the course is designed to be fully online to ensure accessibility for students from across the country and even internationally. This format allows you to learn from anywhere, offering flexibility and convenience while maintaining a high-quality educational experience.

questions.question: What if I miss the live classes?
questions.answer: You can access the recordings on Masai LMS after every session.

questions.question: If I have doubts, will I get one-on-one mentorship?
questions.answer: If you have any queries related to the curriculum, you can raise them during the tutorial session or through discussions. One-to-one mentorship is not available, but in place of that, during the tutorial session, we divide students into small breakout rooms where you can interact with your TAs to get your doubts clarified.

questions.question: Who will support me in case of doubts? Is there a support team or a helpline number?
questions.answer: In case of any doubts, you can raise your issues by raising the support ticket on Masai LMS Platform and you can also attend the regular support sessions conducted on a regular basis.

questions.question: What are the overall program clearance criteria?
questions.answer: The clearance criterion for each Module is 30%.

faqCategories.title: Student Kit, Email ID and Campus Events

questions.question: When will I receive my student kit?
questions.answer: After enrolling and completing the payment of the 1st semester fees afterwards during program orientation you will receive the KIT.

questions.question: What is Campus Immersion, and when will it take place?
questions.answer: Campus Immersion is a two- to three-day event that will take place in the IIT Mandi campus, based on the availability of the campus. The campus immersion takes place after Semester 1. During the Campus immersion event, you get the chance to stay on the campus during this period and will get the chance to interact with your professors. Hostel and Food expenses will be less than Rs 1000 per day during the event. The travel expenses will be on the student.

questions.question: Can I visit the IIT Mandi campus using my student ID anytime?
questions.answer: No, you can not access the IIT Mandi Campus facility at any time. You are allowed to visit the campus for the scheduled events like Orientation, Campus Immersion and Graduation ceremony.

questions.question: Are the campus events mandatory to attend?
questions.answer: We will invite you to the campus for the campus immersion events. It is not mandatory to attend these events.

questions.question: Do I need to pay for the campus immersion?
questions.answer: During the campus events, you need to pay a minimal amount (less than Rs. 1000 per day) for the accommodation and food.

questions.question: Can we participate in college fests hosted at IIT Mandi?
questions.answer: Only if you are participating from your college and your college has been invited for the fest.

questions.question: How many exams will be conducted during the program?
questions.answer: Every Semester there will be 2 evaluations which will be online. At the end of three Modules/end of the program, we will have an offline evaluation which will be scheduled in all major cities and will be within 500 kms from your place.

questions.question: What will be the timings of each evaluation?
questions.answer: Quizzes time 1 hr each & Mid-evaluation & End-Module 1:30 - 2 hrs.

questions.question: What is the clearance criterion for the exams?
questions.answer: The clearance criterion for each semester is 30% in each Module.

questions.question: What will be the deadline for assignments?
questions.answer: During the course, we will release 2 kinds of assignments, one is Daily Learning Checks which are MCQ in nature, has a deadline of 1 day and assignments has a deadline of 10 days.

questions.question: Do we have to give offline exams on campus?
questions.answer: At the end of the program, there will be a mandatory offline exam that will be conducted in major cities across every state. You will be required to select a preferred exam center from the available options and appear for the evaluation in person.The offline exam will not be scheduled at IIT Guwahati campus.

questions.question: What if I fail the exams? Can I continue with the program?
questions.answer: The overall program completion criteria require a score of 30% across all three Modules, which is achievable with consistent effort. If you are unable to meet this requirement, you can reappear for a new batch by paying the course fee and repeating the program.

questions.question: Criteria:
questions.answer: Graduation and available for placements. The detailed process will be shared at the time of placement readiness.

questions.question: What is the placement process after the completion of course?
answer: 1. After the successful completion of the program and upon securing a CGPA of 7 and above, you will be eligible for Internship/placement readiness sessions. This includes support in becoming placement-ready through guidance on the interview process, resume building, and profile development.
2. Once this is complete, you will be onboarded on the placement portal of Masai School, which is our implementation partner for the program.

3. Based on your profile and skill score, you will be able to apply to companies and convert opportunities into offers. You will also be onboarded onto a platform where various companies are present, giving you access to numerous placement opportunities. Additionally, you may have the chance to participate in hiring drives conducted regularly by Masai School.

questions.question: Can I avail of the IIT Mandi Facilities during the course?
questions.answer: You can visit the campus only when invited for the scheduled events. Other than that if you wish to visit the campus, you need to write an email to Masai School so we can seek approvals.

questions.question: Will I be able to attend the IIT Mandi campus placement?
questions.answer: It may not be fair to you, as students from BTech backgrounds will have a different level of competition. Thus to have a level playing ground for all students in this program, you will be onboarded on a placement portal basis your performance i.e. 7 CGPA in the overall program

questions.question: What if I am unable to understand the concepts? Can I discontinue the program?
questions.answer: We understand that some concepts can be challenging, but rest assured, you’ll have plenty of support along the way. You’ll have access to teaching assistant tutorials (Ph.D. scholars from IIT), discussion forums on the Learning Management System (LMS), and sessions with industry experts—all of which are valuable resources to help you clarify any doubts and move forward confidently.Once enrolled, discontinuation is not an option; however, you can request additional support if needed. The program encourages you to stay determined and committed, as persistence is key to success. We are here to provide all the assistance you need throughout your learning journey.

questions.question: I am from a non-technical background. Will I be able to cope with the program?
questions.answer: Yes absolutely, this course is designed in such a way that even a non-tech person can learn everything as its start from basics.

questions.question: I am not comfortable with English. Will the sessions be taught in Hindi or other native languages?
questions.answer: The primary language of the course is English to cater for the demand of all the students.

questions.question: What support will I get during the course?
questions.answer: All live class concepts are supplemented with tutorial sessions, which include recaps and doubt-solving sessions. If you have any doubts about the lectures or assignments, you can raise them using the 'Discussions' feature. The teaching assistant will answer all technical queries and for non-curriculum-related doubts, there will be a two-hour support session on Zoom, where your Program Coordinator will assist you.

questions.question: How will I receive my class schedule?
questions.answer: Learning Management System, Official WhatsApp and the schedule will be shared on a calendar for reference.

questions.question: What platforms will we use for this program?
questions.answer: Zoom, WhatsApp, Learning Management System.

questions.question: What certificate will I receive at the end of the program?
questions.answer: At the end of the program, you will get the certificate of course completion as well as your transcript based on your performance, once you meet the clearance criteria of a minimum of 30%.

questions.question: Will I receive a physical copy of my certificate?
questions.answer: Yes, a physical copy of the certificate will be provided to you.

questions.question: Do we get alumni access to IIT Mandi?
questions.answer: Yes, You will get access to the alumni network of IIT Mandi upon successful completion of the program.

questions.question: What is the validity of the student ID card and email ID?
questions.answer: The student ID card is valid for 18 months from the program start date. However, the student email ID will remain with you even after the program.
